emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Full Stack Development
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems that can autonomously develop, test, and deploy full software applications from high-level requirements.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential job displacement in coding roles, increased efficiency in software production, ethical considerations regarding AI's role in creative and decision-making processes.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: High adoption due to demand for faster software development cycles, though concerns about reliability and security might slow mainstream acceptance.

emerging_technologies.name: Neuro-AI Interfaces
emerging_technologies.description: Advanced brain-computer interfaces that leverage AI to interpret and respond to neural signals more accurately, allowing for thought-controlled computing.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhancements in human capabilities, privacy concerns regarding thought data, potential for cognitive enhancement or manipulation.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption will be gradual due to ethical, regulatory, and technological challenges.

emerging_technologies.name: Decentralized Autonomous Transportation (DAT)
emerging_technologies.description: A network of self-driving vehicles managed by a blockchain-based system for routing, payment, and maintenance, reducing central control.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduction in urban congestion, changes in urban planning, potential job loss in traditional transport sectors, privacy and security concerns with decentralized systems.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: High adoption potential due to the promise of reduced costs and increased efficiency, but regulatory hurdles and initial infrastructure investment could delay widespread use.

emerging_technologies.name: Space Resource Management AI
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems designed to manage and optimize resource extraction and utilization in space environments.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential for new economic models, international space law conflicts, environmental considerations in space.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Dependent on space exploration progress, initial adoption will be limited to space agencies and private space companies.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Assisted Development Environments
mainstream_technologies.description: Integrated development environments where AI not only assists with coding but also with project management, testing, and deployment.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widespread adoption in tech companies, becoming standard in software development practices.

mainstream_technologies.name: Blockchain for Digital Identity
mainstream_technologies.description: Blockchain technology used to secure and manage digital identities, reducing identity theft and enhancing privacy.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Increasingly adopted by governments and corporations for secure identity verification.

epoch_themes.description: Integration of AI into daily human activities to enhance productivity, creativity, and decision-making.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Transformation of work, education, and personal life with AI as a constant companion or collaborator.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased focus on AI ethics, education reform to include AI literacy, and economic models adapting to AI-driven productivity.

epoch_themes.description: A shift towards systems and infrastructures that operate independently of centralized control.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Redistribution of power, new governance models, and challenges to traditional regulatory frameworks.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Growth in peer-to-peer systems, smart contracts, and autonomous governance in various sectors.
